availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel K. Wilson (Carroll County, KY, resident)

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of Allen Wilson and Ann Wilson. Resident of Caroll County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Carroll County in 1850. Attended school in Carroll County in 1860. Household owned four enslaved persons in Carroll County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 2, p. 196A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 2, p. 906.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Worthville, p. 129.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Worthville, p. 243B.
"Samuel K Wilson (1838-1926)," Find A Grave, Memorial 79645541, accessed January 27, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79645541.
